content.body:
anyone else having problems with the bikeshed server? I'm getting "

WARNING: mysqli_connect(): (HY000/2002): Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' (111)

"
wanderview: you can ping plinns on GitHub for help perhaps
content.formatted_body: wanderview: you can ping plinns on GitHub for help perhaps

content.body: what repo is the bikeshed server associated with?
I don't know, if you don't have a PR or something I guess I'd file an issue against tabatkins/bikeshed
wanderview: none, plinss hosts it (see also drafts.csswg.org being down)
content.formatted_body: wanderview: none, plinss hosts it (see also drafts.csswg.org being down)

content.body: I guess if the outage is wider scope then maybe its already known about

> <@annevk:mozilla.org> Domenic: implementations have non-JS streams

Sure but when do they create ReadableStream objects and enqueue from them, is the question. I think you could get away without a first-class non-JS stream primitive in the spec since you can just pretend the data hasn't reached you yet if it's queued up.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:mozilla.org
Domenic: implementations have non-JS streams
Sure but when do they create ReadableStream objects and enqueue from them, is the question. I think you could get away without a first-class non-JS stream primitive in the spec since you can just pretend the data hasn't reached you yet if it's queued up.

content.body: Domenic: I suspect it gets created the moment someone "touches" it
content.formatted_body: Domenic: I suspect it gets created the moment someone "touches" it

content.body: Hmm I don't think that's true in Chrome
As in, once someone does res.body
